intro: Sisymbrium exacoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf wild radish, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are elongated and have a distinctive, serrated edge. Sisymbrium exacoides typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields or along roadsides.
